articles.author: Joseph Ax
articles.description: Donald Trump will be sworn in today, ushering in another turbulent four-year term with promises to push the limits of executive power, deport millions of immigrants, secure retribution against his political enemies and transform the role of the US on the world stage.
articles.title: Triumphant Trump returns to White House, launching new era of upheaval

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: By Hatem Khaled, Mohammed Salem and Nidal al-Mughrabi
articles.title: Palestinian rescue workers begin search for people under rubble on day two of ceasefire

articles.author: Vitalii Hnidyi, Yurii Kovalenko
articles.description: As Donald Trump's second term as U.S. president dawns, Ukrainian soldiers and civilians see a hard road ahead in their war with Russia, and many have come to hope for a ceasefire without expelling Russian forces.
articles.title: As Trump era begins, Ukrainians are exhausted by war

articles.author: Kenneth Li
articles.description: The app and website were operational on Monday, but TikTok was still not available for download in the Apple and Google app stores, suggesting the two companies were waiting for clearer legal assurances.
articles.title: TikTok awaits Trump reprieve as China signals it is open to a deal

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Jack Kim
articles.description: South Korea's impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol refused on Monday to be questioned by investigators under a probe into whether he committed insurrection, as dozens of his supporters faced arrest over a violent rampage on a court building.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon shuns questioning as security tightened after court rampage

articles.author: Joe Cash, Josh Arslan, Ryan Woo
articles.description: Chinese officials and ordinary people are hopeful but on edge as Donald Trump returns to the White House, eager to avoid a repeat of the bruising trade war that drove a wedge between the economic superpowers during his first term.
articles.title: China both hopeful and on edge as Trump returns to White House

articles.author: Doina Chiacu
articles.description: Trump has repeatedly called for the prosecution of his perceived enemies.
articles.title: Biden issues pardons to protect Milley, Fauci, Cheney from Trump retaliation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A British teenager on Monday pleaded guilty to charges of murdering three young girls in a knife attack in northern England in July, a crime that horrified the nation and was followed by days of nationwide rioting.
articles.title: UK teenager pleads guilty to murder of Southport girls and ricin, terrorism charges

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Donald Trump will be sworn in as the 47th president of the United States on Monday at an inauguration ceremony that has been scaled back due to a forecast of severe cold weather in the nation's capital.
articles.title: Explainer: Capital One arena takes centre stage at Trump's inauguration

articles.author: Andrew Mills, Ahmed Mohamed Hassan
articles.description: The deal is playing out in the shadow of mutual mistrust and bitterness.
articles.title: Mediators on standby for obstacles as Gaza ceasefire starts
